file_content.text: Words are not my strength.
Persistence will get you nowhere. When I wish to talk, you'll know.
I will not be with you long.
Do not begin to think I am yours. This is a convenient arrangement, that is all.
Just humor me. It's two syllables: "Hell-oh." I know you can do it if you put your mind to it.
Let's try this again. Hello!
Hello.
Hi. How are you? Is this starting to sound familiar?
Let's keep going.
Pretty soon, we'll be braiding each other's hair and talking about boys.
Better already.
Long hair is a detriment. It gives your enemies a handhold in a fight.
I did not come to make small talk. I need somewhere to bunk while I track down my clan's enemies.
See? I bet if you really worked at it, you could even smile....
[Flirt] Was that so hard?
My clan is dead and I have not avenged them. What would make me smile?
Just tell me if you need anything.
I've got things to do.
Doesn't mean we can't chat while you're here, right? Share a few secrets, shed a few tears?
We can still be friends.
I have no clan. What more do you need to know?
I will travel with you as long as our interests coincide.
Sorry to bother you.
If that's what you want, fine.
It is no bother. I just wanted to... be clear.
I appreciate my place here.
I was wrong.
Context, please?
About what?
I've never heard you admit that.
Can I get that in writing?
Your judgment is perfect. After all, you chose me....
[Flirt] You're never wrong.
My one lapse.
You have changed me. When I joined you, I thought it would be a moment's distraction. I had sworn never to give my loyalty again.
I was wrong.
Normal people start with a little idle chitchat, build up to the point they're trying to make....
I hate when you do that.
This is my point.
When I joined your crew, I told you I would never serve another's interests again. I could not trust anyone's purpose to suit my own.
I was wrong. The longer I stay, the more loyalty I feel.
There is nothing in my lifetime that could make me leave your side.
For any Mandalorian, family is most important. That is instilled from birth.
Whether you join the clan by blood or adoption, every Mandalorian seeks to one day have children to pass our traditions down to.
When I left, I assumed that was over. What did I have that was worth passing on?
Are you looking for someone to make rug rats with?
Have you changed your mind?
I know there can never be a child of our bodies, but perhaps one day we will find a child worth taking into our lives.
I am your family. I want you to be my wife.
You have a family now.
I'm really not the "raise a bunch of rug rats" type.
It is over.
Whatever legacy you wish to leave, I would stand by your side.
"Ni vore gar riduurok. Gar riduur."
Those are the words of our marriage ceremony. They declare a bond of trust and affection between partners.
Ni vore... gar riduurok. Gar riduur.... For as long as we both shall live.
I give you my vow.
This was my father's helmet. I recovered it after he was taken by the Empire.
I want you to have it.
I do not need it with me any longer to mourn the family I lost. I have a family now.
I do. You do. Now let's get to the honeymoon.
Let's celebrate.
You never change....
Who said anything about marriage?
Marriage?
I thought that was what we were to each other. A life-long bond.
Perhaps I have been wrong this whole time.
I have no clan, and the man who destroyed it is dead. Without clan or foe, I am no longer a Mandalorian.
But I am still a warrior--and great ones don't allow old age to take them.
To die in battle, dragging many foes into the Void: that is a good ending. What do you think, Captain?
I'm retiring to a resort planet somewhere. You have fun with that Void thing.
I'd rather be rich.
You'd rather collapse into sloth and weakness? Draw your final diseased breath lying in bed? That isn't living.
I was planning to live forever. It's not as flashy as your idea, but it works for me.
Dying isn't on my agenda.
I should've known better than to expect a serious answer from you.
Last thing I wanna do is get old and boring. Sign me up for the Void.
Sounds like fun.
Perhaps we will go there together.
A warrior's end requires a worthy foe. We should keep fighting until we find ours.
Tomorrow, we die. Today, someone else will. "Ib'tuur jatne tuur ash'ad kyr'amur."
When I accepted your kiss, I did not expect you to come away with my heart.
But I find myself thinking of you as more than a lover.
I want to share every moment with you.
I love you, Akaavi.
I want to be with you, too.
I... ni kar'tayli gar darasuum.
I did not expect ever to say that to a man.
I don't know about "every moment...."
That's a bit much.
Don't worry. I'll preserve some mystery.
I've got something to share with you, too....
How about right now?
Oh!
For the first time in months, I've allowed myself to think about the future. Some day, this war must end.
What will you do when the Sith Empire rules the galaxy? Will you transfer your loyalties to them? What if your profession is outlawed?
I'll stay in business. If the Republic can't put a slave collar on me, neither can the Empire.
I'll survive.
How much experience do you have with the Empire's slave trade? It's highly advanced.
Have you been following current events? The Empire's on the express hyperlane to nowhere.
The Empire won't win.
A rancor becomes twice as deadly when it's backed into a corner.
Why all the sudden concern? Figuring out if you should jump ship?
What do you care?
Concern for my well-being doesn't exclude an interest in yours.
The only constant in life is change. A warrior prepares for whatever comes.
Your talent for survival is impressive, Captain, but luck has its limits.
You look... well, not exactly happy. Less angry than usual.
It's over. The filth who destroyed my clan and dishonored its name is dead.
Great. You can help deal with my enemies.
I'm glad that's done.
I welcome more worthy foes.
I'm guessing the real story's a little more complicated. Wouldn't mind hearing it.
Do you want to talk about it?
There is little to tell. It was violent, and brief.
Hope you made it as painful as possible.
Revenge is good.
The only feeling I have is certainty. My enemy deserved his fate.
Before he died, Rook confessed his crime. He destroyed my clan because the lie gained him a favorable contract with the Empire.
He killed my people for profit--nothing more. The galaxy is no poorer without him.
People who do terrible things for profit... boy, I'm glad I don't know anyone who fits that description.
We're not all that different.
Before taking a profit, always analyze the cost.
What about the people serving Rook? Your old lover? Did all those people deserve to die?
Your revenge was pointless.
They had no honor. The smart ones ran and survived. The foolish ones are fertilizing Hutta.
That's great, but you can only kill your enemies once. Now what?
Do you have another reason to live, or should you just space yourself right now and get it over with?
I did what honor demanded, without regret. I still have this ship--and you.
Tell me you got something out of this besides revenge.
Did you at least get rich?
Rook was an even worse businessman than Mandalorian. His so-called clan lived in squalor.
I could not have avenged my people without the resources and opportunities you've provided.
I will repay that debt, Captain.
Tayari Rook claims to lead his own clan!
He destroyed my clan with his slander, then dares to raise up his mishmash of slavers and pirates and call them "Clan Rook"!
And no one has challenged them!
Maybe you can kill him twice.
I guess that's your job.
Twice is a mercy!
Haven't the other Mandalorian clans caught wind of this? Shouldn't they be angry, too?
How is this possible?
Rook is careful. Anyone who could speak against him is already dead or dishonored.
You're not Mandalorian anymore, remember? Let it go.
Who cares?
Rook took that away from me! I will not let him go!
That isn't even the worst of it. The man I was with when my people fell... his clan lost all honor after I left. They joined Clan Rook.
My old lover dishonors the name Mandalorian. That coward dies with the rest of Rook's filth.
Once they're all dead, you'll finally be satisfied?
And then you're done?
This has never been personal. It's about justice.
Killing the man who betrayed your clan is one thing. Killing everyone who works for him seems a little extreme.
You're getting out of control.
If Rook's followers run like the cowards they are, they might survive.
First he turned his back on you, then he joined up with the man who betrayed you. I say he deserves whatever he gets.
It seems only fair.
I've often wondered if you listened when I told you about my people. Now I know.
Rook's clan is on Hutta, bowing and scraping for the Cartel. The scum have no discipline. Destroying their camp will be easy.
When I'm finished, it will be as if Clan Rook never existed. I leave for Hutta immediately....
It's not easy to get time alone with you, Captain.
Maybe we should make up an urgent mission for Risha and Corso and everyone. Somewhere at least an hour away.
An hour? I think I'm insulted. We'll need the whole night.
[Flirt] Good idea.
I took the liberty of booking them a room planet-side.
You will be the first outsider to be this close to me without my armor.
They've been missing out.
You're beautiful.
Keep the helmet on....
Just take off some of it.
Ha.
We've only got another twelve hours. Let's not waste it.
Enough talking.
Mmm....
I had no idea all those "smuggling compartments" were for more than just cargo.
That's it! I've had it with you two sneaking around here. Out!
Me? What of you? I will not tolerate this insult any longer.
It is one thing to watch your eye stray on every world we visit, but I will not live with a rival in my own home!
You knew her first. But no man of honor would begin to court me before permanently ending whatever understanding you had with her.
Finally. Something we agree on.
Give up your claim to him. He has chosen me.
Girls, girls. There's plenty of me to share....
Can't I have both?
Not in your wildest--never mind. That's probably exactly what you dream about.
There is only one way to resolve this. I challenge you to an honor duel. Whoever loses must leave the ship and the captain forever.
You've got to be kidding me.
After all the time you spent chasing me, Captain, now that you have me, you'd throw it all away? I don't buy it. Choose.
Who's it going to be? Akaavi or me?
I can't decide. Why don't you two fight it out?
I want to watch the duel.
Love isn't something you settle with blasters.
Why not?
If he doesn't care enough to decide, you can have him! I'm not going to squabble like two kids with a toy.
You haven't been nearly as much fun since you started to like me.
I choose Akaavi.
Well, you're in luck. That's over.
Sorry, Akaavi. My life could never be complete without Risha insulting me.
I choose Risha.
Fine.
That's right, Risha. It's been fun, but... you don't have the helmet.
I've chosen Akaavi.
You are a sick, sick man.
Do you not accept his choice? Shall we duel for who remains a part of this crew?
I don't want your leftovers. You can have him!
Were she Mandalorian, we would both be dead now. Do not ever put me in that position.
That's not your call, Akaavi. It's been fun, but... Risha's had my heart since before I met you.
I've chosen Risha.
If I was only a conquest to you, Captain, consider it over.
I am not here for you to run to every time you make Risha mad.
But that explains the holorecorders in them....
Don't look at those. The other girls meant nothing to me.
I need to erase those.
I would not judge you on your past. Do not judge me on mine.
We will have a new beginning, together.
Don't you hate ruining a perfectly good friendship for one anti-climactic night?
This was a mistake.
Yes.
Just wait until we kick off the artificial grav....
We've still got some time....
Oh!
I like to have all my friends around. The more, the merrier.
I don't think so.
Your friends... I see. I will not presume to be anything more than that.
I'd rather have a night alone with a Wookiee.
Stop hitting on me!
You have made yourself clear. I will not bother you again.
I do not presume to question your choice of crew mates, but I am curious. Why allow yourself to be surrounded by the weak?
Only the Wookiee displays any strength of character. He understands honor. The rest are petty criminals.
I can't tell you how many times the others have come to me singing your praises.
They hate you, too.
I don't value the favor of those weaker than myself.
Cut the farm boy some slack. He's good in a fight. He even has a conscience.
Corso has a good heart.
He is too weak of spirit to make hard choices. He will hesitate, and fail you.
Petty criminals are easier to manage. When they start complaining, just throw some credits at them.
I like them that way.
And what happens when they demand more than you're willing to pay?
One thing a Mandalorian never has to question is a clan-mate's honor. I could always count on the strength of my fellow warriors.
I always sleep lightly aboard your ship.
I have learned more about the scum who betrayed my clan. Tayari Rook claims he has earned the title Mandalorian.
But I heard nothing of him passing the trials of strength and courage required to join a clan.
Sell your services as a Mandalorian without the whole honor and loyalty thing. Why didn't I think of that?
What a ruse! Brilliant!
Because any true Mandalorian would be honor-bound to kill you.
What does it take to be adopted as a Mandalorian?
Tell me about the trials.
It is up to each clan. We do not care much for central authority.
But no one would accept a new brother who had not shown his worth.
Tell me when you get something actionable.
Keep me posted.
I know I cannot honestly take the name Mandalorian any longer. But I cannot let another claim it who has less right than I do.
I have called myself Mandalorian since I left my mother's side at age three to begin training. It is not easy to put that behind me.
Most kids that age are mastering the toilet, not the blaster.
Age three?
Most kids are not Mandalorian.
We start training for war when our bodies and minds are still elastic--to make what we learn a part of ourselves.
Do you want to go back? Live as a Mandalorian again?
You don't have to.
My father's training will always be part of me.
I had a jetpack and blaster before I ever had a friend.
You may be my first.
"Ke ba'jurir gar'ade, jagyc'ade kot'la a dalyc'ade kotla'shya." Train your sons to be strong, but your daughters to be stronger.
It'd be easier if you stopped talking about it constantly.
Get over it.
You're right.
There is a method to your madness.
When we met, I thought your fighting was driven by impulse, with no strategy or plan.
But I begin to see a pattern in the chaos.
No. You were right the first time. I've got no idea what I'm doing.
I'm just making it up.
I have been studying your moves for some time now.
Maybe we can have a few... practice sessions. Teach you some dirty tricks.
[Flirt] I could teach you....
I believe I've learned those tricks already, Captain.
I am speaking of how you fight. There is more I can learn from you than I thought.
You sound like you want to learn.
I could teach you....
I have already made a study of you, Captain.
My style serves me well.
It's deliberate.
That, I have never questioned.
I have thought of incorporating some of your... tricks... into my own repertoire.
It would certainly earn me the edge of surprise should I be among Mandalorians again.
I considered thinking up some coy comment to greet you with.
But that is not me.
I see the games of flirtation you play, but I cannot take part.
You could start with a joke. I'd love to hear you laugh, Akaavi.
Try it, you might like it.
A Mandalorian woman goes to a Hutt arms dealer and says, "I want to buy a blaster. It's for my husband."
The Hutt says, "What kind does he prefer? Carbine? Rifle?"
"What does he care?" the woman says. "He doesn't even know I'm going to kill him."
Ha! I didn't know Mandalorians told jokes.
That's hilarious.
Usually non-Mandalorians don't see the humor in them.
I always heard it about a spacer and his nagging wife.
I know that one.
From the spacers I've met, the wife is more likely to be pulling the trigger.
I take it back. Don't tell jokes.
That was terrible.
I didn't claim it was a skill.
If I want to flirt, I can go to any cantina in the galaxy. There's no one out there like you.
I like you just how you are.
Then you do like me. I wasn't sure whether you were only hoping to remake me in your image.
If you cracked a joke, it would kill the whole macho, prison-buddy vibe you've got going on.
Don't try it.
It is clearly not my strength. I can never tell when you're joking.
I cannot put a name on our relationship. Among Mandalorians, there are two types of union a woman seeks with a man.
A casual one, pursued for mutual enjoyment. Or a serious one, intended to make more children for the clan.
You left off love. Is that not a reason?
What about love?
"Ni kar'tayli gar darasuum." That is the closest thing we say to "love." It means "I will know you forever."
It implies you will risk your own death to ensure that you are never left without them.
I have only heard it in stories. No man or woman I knew ever said it.
Nothing wrong with a little mutual enjoyment.
I pick "casual."
Before, you said you wanted more than that.
No reason we can't have both....
This feels way too much like "talking about our relationship."
This talk isn't my thing.
Less talk, more action. I'll keep that in mind.
My travels with you have been worthwhile, Captain. Few Mandalorians experience Republic space as I have.
Fewer still see the Jedi up close without having to kill them.
I appreciate your restraint. What is it with Mandalorians and Jedi, anyway?
Why do you hate the Jedi?
We can only grow stronger through conflict against worthy foes.
You wouldn't last two seconds against the Jedi I've met.
Consider yourself lucky.
I've fought their kind and lived.
Don't hold back on my account. As long as nobody traces it back to this ship, kill whomever you like.
Kill all you want.
I've had no reason to fight Jedi while in your company. If that changes, I appreciate your gesture of consent.
Jedi are the most respected warriors in the galaxy. And yet, they have never truly defeated the Mandalorians.
No matter how punishing our defeats by them, we always return. One day, the Jedi will bow down before us.
What are you looking for from me, Captain?
You have expressed interest in a relationship, yet you continue to eye others every time we land.
Am I a crew member? A friend? Are we to be lovers?
All of those. I want to share my life with you, Akaavi.
[Flirt] More than that.
I have never thought to make such a commitment to any man.
Why? Do you see so much of yourself in me? Do you think I would follow you blindly and never question your choices?
You want me to share your life--what would that life be?
It's going to take a tight rein to keep my business in order.
We'll run my criminal empire.
I do not think of myself as a criminal, but in Republic space, that is what I am.
I like how you use your Republic assignments to cull profit and followers for yourself.
Perhaps that is a future I could be persuaded to share....
You've seen it. I'm not giving up the freedom of my own ship until I'm cold and buried.
It'll be just like this.
It is funny that you call this freedom, when it means you spend every waking moment working for someone else.
I cannot imagine settling down, but I also do not wish to spend my life running errands for anyone who can pay.
Maybe we can find something more, together.
Once our reflexes slow down, I figured we'd get a bungalow on some little moon, adopt a couple of cocky street kids, maybe a dog....
I want a wife and children.
That is hardly the future I'd imagined.
My mother fought off four raiders single-handedly when eight months pregnant, and returned to training when I was twelve weeks old.
There is no room in Mandalorian life for your idea of domestic bliss.
I'm game if you are.
[Flirt] Lovers would be fun.
Perhaps we should find somewhere more private to discuss it....
I need a little more romance than "get in the back of the starship, babe...."
We'll never be a couple.
I misunderstood. I will not bother you with this again.
Tell me, Captain... how do you choose your path in life? What guides you?
Mostly, I follow the credits--and more is always better.
Money.
I thought only droids were ruled by numbers.
My code's simple: treat everyone how I want them to treat me.
I try to play fair.
That is no code. It is wishful thinking.
I prefer improvisation. Only a fool gets locked into a single way of thinking.
Nothing--codes are for idiots.
You're like a starship without navigation. Flying blind.
I adhere to the Resol'nare. The core of what it means to be Mandalorian. A sacred law giving us direction and purpose.
Education and armor, self-defense, our tribe, our language, our leader--all help us survive.
We must educate our children as Mandalorians, obey the commands of Mandalore, speak Mando'a and defend our clans.
Did you leave out something? I didn't hear anything about serving the Empire and wiping out the Republic.
Plus the murderous violence.
Every action a Mandalorian takes is because of the Resol'nare. It tells us why we fight--and whom to kill.
I'm thinking the galaxy has the wrong idea about Mandalorians. You people sound alright.
I like your code.
Few have the strength to follow the Resol'nare. That is why the weak always hate us.
Live however you want--just don't tell me about it.
You're boring me.
I assumed you were interested. I stand corrected.
Why am I here, Captain?
I have been clear about my reason for joining you. But I never understood what you want from me.
Am I a hired gun? Or is there something more?
You know what I want. I just didn't think you were ready to talk about it.
[Flirt] You're more than that.
How do you know if you don't ask?
It may have started that way, but now you're part of my crew. You're family.
We're friends.
We have a proverb. "Aliit ori'shya tal'din." Family is more than bloodline. But it refers to adoption by a clan, not...
What do you care?
I ask the questions here.
Why else would I want you around?
You're a hired gun.
Why did you assemble this crew? It is too momentous a decision to make on impulse.
Do your loyalties truly lie with the Republic?
When the Empire's cantinas start serving deuterium-pyros, maybe I'll reconsider.
Reps are more fun than Imps.
I serve the Republic.
The Republic is a big self-righteous pool of money, and I've got swimming privileges.
I'm only loyal to myself.
The Republic worships its own weakness.
They waste their warriors defending those who cannot care for themselves. They call for loyalty to a government of strangers instead of family and clan.
You could do better.
You made it back alive. I assume the Imperial wasn't so lucky?
That sniveling worm was no more the architect of my clan's destruction than Moff Tyrak was. I left him alive, wallowing in his disgrace.
Major Stanwu ordered the execution because of lies told to him by another Mandalorian--Tayari Rook. The true crime rests with him.
That must have been one whopper of a lie to get your whole clan wiped out.
Rook was quite convincing.
Why do I get the feeling you'll have yet another person you want to kill after this Tayari Rook character is dead?
Are you sure about that?
The lie stops with Rook. He acted alone.
What would make a fellow Mandalorian want to sell out your clan?
Betrayed by your own? Why?
I will ask the traitor his reasons before I kill him.
Rook presented Major Stanwu with evidence that Clan Spar reneged on a contract. My people were hired to destroy transport ships full of young Jedi, but the Empire's target survived.
If Clan Spar had accepted that contract, the Jedi would be dead. Rook framed us.
What did he stand to gain from your clan's destruction?
This doesn't make any sense.
His motives don't matter. They can't save him.
Only a Mandalorian could get insulted over not being a mass-murderer.
Framed for being nice.
A Mandalorian's word is sacred. Contracts must be fulfilled, regardless of details.
You already know what to do. Find this Rook and stick a blaster in his face.
So kill him.
I've already begun my hunt for Tayari Rook. I will settle his debt to Clan Spar.
I have a name!
"Akaavi"?
Has it changed?
Not me!
Good. I guess....
I know whose order Moff Tyrak signed. To execute my clan. It was sent by Imperial Major Stanwu.
Who is it? What have you learned?
The man who set up your clan?
The order Moff Tyrak signed came from Imperial Major Stanwu.
I've heard of him. He is a liaison between the Empire and hired bounty hunters.
I will kill him.
Yeah, I figured you weren't going to stop with a scolding.
Not a shock.
You can't just walk up to an Imperial Major and blast him. Do you have an actual plan?
How will you do it?
I'll exploit the Major's position and turn it against him.
Good luck. I'll say something nice at your funeral.
And get yourself killed, too.
You think I'll attack blindly? A Mandalorian's rage burns cold.
The major is hiring the best bounty hunters on Nar Shaddaa. I will go there and present myself as one of them.
Once I secure a meeting with Major Stanwu, all that's left is to pull the trigger.
There's another step after that: get the blazes off Nar Shaddaa before the Empire catches you.
Don't forget to run away.
This is not my first execution. I always leave myself an exit.
Is it too late for a discussion about letting this go? Just live and let live?
Can I talk you out of this?
If the major did not wish to die, he should not have killed my clan.
Take you time and enjoy. I recommend aiming for the kneecaps first.
Make him pay.
There's no honor in torture--but he will live long enough to know why his life is ending.
If we do not see each other again... re'turcye mhi.
Are there things you regret, Captain?
It is not an emotion I was raised to feel. We act. And we face the consequences with courage.
But it is far easier to discipline my body than my mind.
Why waste time worrying about the last galaxy-shattering mistake, when a worse one's coming tomorrow?
I try to live without regrets.
There is no worse failure than abandoning my clan.
How about you work on your mind and leave the body to me...?
[Flirt] I can help.
Do you want to talk about it?
What do you regret?
I should have been with my clan when the Empire came for them. I had left to join another clan, to follow a lover.
It's not a weakness to admit you've done the wrong thing.
Don't fight it.
Was it wrong? What young girl has not left her clan for a time to travel with a lover?
But while I was with him, the Empire came for my people.
At the moment they were betrayed, I knew nothing.
I don't imagine anyone can just walk up and arrest a bunch of Mandalorians.
What happened?
The Empire could not have succeeded without treachery.
I only know they used some kind of time-release poison, then "arrested" them as they lay unconscious.
When I called for my lover's clan to defend them, the cowards refused. They were not true Mandalorians.
I never imagined you with a lover.
You had a lover?
I thought that was the only way you imagined me.
Am I not a woman grown? Do you think Mandalorians have no gift for the gentler arts?
His name was Zadik Lone. When we learned the Empire had betrayed my clan, I told Zadik to rally his people to defend them.
The cowards buried their ears. They would not come to the aid of a fellow clan. I left that day.
I thought that story would end with, "so I tore them limb-from-limb and used their corpses as jet fuel."
You didn't kill them?
Their cowardice did not kill my clan. Let them live with their guilt. It is the Empire that must pay.
A sad story.
A Mandalorian does not ask for tears shed over his corpse, only that his death be visited tenfold on those who killed him!
It's over. Might as well get used to it.
Nothing you can do now.
Blah blah, clan. Blah blah, betrayed. Aren't we past that yet?
Are you still harping on that?
I will not burden you with my memories again.
I did not expect our travels to linger so long, Captain.
I kept thinking I would leave at the next port, but I... appreciate the trust you have shown me.
And, more often than not, I admire your decisions. You can be far more ruthless than your reputation suggests.
You've certainly opened my eyes to some new ways of looking at things.
I admire you, too.
I did not expect us to find so much common ground.
I should have guessed you like it rough.
[Flirt] Ruthless is good?
When you look at me like that... are you interested in me as a woman?
Is this your way of pursuing a relationship?
Boy, you know how to make a man's heart go pitter-pat.
[Flirt] Try some romance.
You would prefer I play hard to get? Why should we not speak directly?
I didn't realize I just had to put in an order.
[Flirt] Yes.
Five years ago, my lover refused to come to my clan's aid. I left him.
I have not known a man since.
Can't a guy flirt without you thinking he's into chicks with horns?
No.
I will remember not to insult you that way.
Guess where I picked that up?
You're a good teacher.
There's something creepy and unnatural about you complimenting me.
Ugh. Don't try to be nice.
I will remember to avoid that.
You are not what I expected, Captain.
I've seen you in battle; I know you can fight.
But I have been killing Jedi and Republic troopers since my childhood, and you are nothing like them.
What, do Mandalorian kids not know "tag"?
You fought as a child?
Even the youngest Mandalorian child would rather prove her mettle in a real fight than play games for points.
You mean you never met a Republic man so ruggedly handsome, startlingly brave and dazzlingly clever?
[Flirt] Not like them how?
They fought with valor and discipline. You fight with words and tricks.
You mean a coward with no discipline and no greater loyalty than myself?
How am I not like them?
My father would have thought so.
He would have seen no honor in fighting a woman who uses words and tricks to turn a battle.
He did not see any honor in facing a man who would not fight him head-to-head.
Don't judge me.
I didn't ask your opinion.
You cannot ask that. I will not speak, if you wish, but I cannot see you and not take your measure.
My father would not have thought you an honorable opponent.
But I have seen your victories. I believe you are a worthy foe.
Was I just complimented or insulted?
Is that a good thing?
And what do Mandalorian women do with a "worthy foe"? Rahrr....
[Flirt] Worthy of what?
Usually, they kill him.
I'm not your enemy, Akaavi. I thought we were friends.
I'm not a "foe."
Don't make me show you how "worthy" I am.
You'd better.
It was meant as praise.
A warrior can only challenge herself against enemies of honor and courage. There is no honor in attacking those beneath you.
A worthy foe is a gift. In defeating them, we hone ourselves to the best we can be and bring honor to the name "Mandalorian."
Or so I was taught.
Your crew has welcomed me. I did not expect that.
What's the usual protocol for Mandalorians turning against the Empire and joining a shiftless spacer's crew?
What did you expect?
I would call no part of that "usual."
We've got an open-door policy.
They're used to it.
Don't think this means they like you.
It's not personal.
I do not need their approval.
It was not coincidence I came to you on Balmorra. Your name is famous among bounty hunters for the price both Skavak and Rogun put on you.
I wanted to see who was worth so many credits.
What can I say? My fans are generous.
People love me.
Greedy men are willing to throw away fortunes on you--but I value more than credits.
Can you put a credit value on this? I always thought I was priceless....
[Flirt] I'm undervalued.
Every man and woman has someone who will pay to see them dead. Most just don't follow through.
Do not worry.
I'm a little insulted the price isn't higher. Is that why you haven't taken a shot at me?
I'm undervalued.
Stop looking at me like you're figuring out the tally per-body-part.
Don't even try to collect.
You gave me food and bed. I would not betray you.
I would not give this up for a bounty.
We should talk. Make time on the ship.
We should talk. Let me know when you have time.
Not now.
If I must.
As you like.
Your priorities continue to mystify me.
You do what you need to. Just expect me to do the same.
I will get out of your way.
I've got nowhere else to be.
We're wasting our time.
Hello.
I will travel with you as long as our interests coincide.
Why am I here, Captain?
We can only grow stronger through conflict against worthy foes.
I welcome more worthy foes.
